column4: My box drops to grub on boot. For some reason I set it up to boot from some lvm configuration a while ago, but upgrading distros seems to hvae broken it. I've booted knoppix, but now I'm  at a loss on what to do. Is there some type of automatic reconfiguration tool?
to clarify, i have one physical volume that contains one volume group. And I want to boot from it
Is the shell you get at boot a "grub> " prompt or a "rescue> " prompt?
It's a grub> prompt
Do you see any error message?
no, it just drops to grub with no complaints
Could you run boot info script as explained here: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1291280 and pastebin the RESULTS.txt?
Here's the output of the bootinfo script http://privatepaste.com/1070d1e642 and here's the output of all the lvm diag commands I could think of http://privatepaste.com/829402f98d
the sda1 and sdb1 drives are connected via sata and I'm just using them as storage. I want to boot from the sdc drive
Please install 'unlzma' and re-run boot info script.
It would be easier if you booted from an Ubuntu LiveCD.
I'll boot from the ubuntu liveCD and re-run it
I'm going to be away for about an hour.
should I PM you the link, or should I just post it in the channel when it's done?
Just post it in-channel when it's done. That '>' prompt means that you forgot to close a quote and it's waiting for the rest of a multi line quote.
here's the paste of bootinfoscript http://privatepaste.com/47fdae127c though, it still complains about unlzma even though it's installed on the ubuntu livecd
It looks like you don't have any grub.cfg at all. How did you install Ubuntu? Is this a fresh install?
no, I just ssh'd in and did a do-release-upgrade and then it didn't boot anymore.
I just mounted the partition myself and did a new grub-install, so i'll see where that gets me

so I guess at this point I'm looking for a way to reinstall grub on an lvm (with a separate /boot partition)... from a live cd. I haven't found a guide that combines all three of those elements, and I'm pretty hesitant to try anything drastic myself.
I got it fixed. :) Took a lot of manual configuration, but I just needed a quick fix to bootstrap it up
